trigger_event: Oksana receives urgent analysis confirming Halden embedded hidden system triggers capable of exposing BCI secrets or suspending assignments, and is authorized to decide which action to activate.
dilemma: Oksana must decide whether to reveal Halden’s secrets by broadcasting his hidden confession and declassifying BCI records, or instead trigger a two-week suspension of all BCI assignments, forcing citizens to self-organize without system control.
reason: Both choices come with heavy risks—exposing the truth could splinter the city and cause public trauma, while removing BCI assignments could spark chaos, leaving vulnerable citizens at risk. Oksana hesitates, weighed down by the possibility of irreversible damage whichever path she chooses.
choice_a: Broadcast Halden’s confession and authorize full declassification of BCI records, exposing the truth about the city’s manipulation.
belief_a: Only transparency can heal the city’s wounds.
Reckoning with the past is better than living a comfortable lie.
Lasting trust can’t be rebuilt unless people understand the true cost.
choice_b: Trigger Halden's contingency: suspend all BCI assignments, forcing city districts to survive and organize without algorithmic order for two weeks.
belief_b: People need space to prove they can run their own lives, even if it’s messy.
True civic growth only happens when control is relinquished.
Testing survival without the system may be painful but is the only way to learn.
